title: View: India’s deposit crunch has a taste of China’s past
description: India's banks are facing a deposit shortage, causing concern among bankers and policymakers. Measures like restraining money growth to combat inflation, aggressive taxation on savings, and insufficient interest rates for savers are contributors. The Reserve Bank of India warns about potential liquidity issues, increasing the need for banks to mobilize household savings effectively.
